intro: Susanna microglossa, commonly known as the small-lipped susanna, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Susanna microglossa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
